strings.Value: [Throw the bird's bones into the water]
{n}The pond is deep and the water cold. Although the surface is still, you can hear faint whispers, as if someone beneath the water is murmuring sadly to themselves.{/n}
{n}As you stare into the water for a time, you see something odd — a reflection of a beautiful woman comes into focus, sitting on the bank, weeping. But as soon as you blink, the image is gone.{/n}
{n}The stone skips on the water, leaving circles on its surface, then finally disappears with a last, short splash. The pond falls silent, nothing stirs.{/n}

{n}The water tastes bitter, with a trace of salt — as the salt touches the tongue, you feel a sharp pain in your heart, as if suddenly stabbed — not with a blade, but with a painful memory of something lost.{/n}
{n}The bones of the bird disappear in depths of the pond… and suddenly the water's surface heaves, darkens, boils. It changes color — and now looks swirling, furious, menacing.{/n}
"What a beautiful, calm place... Can we stay here a while longer?"
"This place is overflowing with the events of the past," {n}Linzi whispers.{/n} "If only I knew its history... If only..."
{n}The water has grown dark and menacing.{/n}
